sysevent_email_action.description: Reminder to managers that haven't complete PDR Reviews for their direct reports.
sysevent_email_action.message_html:
Dear ${name},

 

The PDR system will close Friday, March 16 at 1:00 pm CST.  You are receiving this e-mail because there are employees that report to you that are awaiting your comments and ratings.  On your approval the form will be sent to your manager for final review and approval.  Please review the PDR steps below.   Once the forms are closed, the 2017 ratings are closed, the 2018 goals and development plans will be accessible during mid-year. 

 

${mail_script:pending_pdrs}

 

The PDR cycle consists of 6 steps:

 

  1. Employee rating, goal setting and development plan draft
  2. Functional Manager’s comments (if applicable)
  3. Supervisor’s rating, review of goals and development plan for 2018
  4. Manager’s review
  5. Supervisor and Employee PDR meeting
  6. Employee acknowledgement of meeting with supervisor

 

Employees are responsible for drafting goals, developing their development plan for 2018 and ensuring they meet the deadlines (Steps 1 and 6) 

Supervisors are responsible for reviewing and providing feedback to the employee, making changes to goals and the development plans, getting input as needed from Functional leader, entering final employee rating, and scheduling and conducting the PDR meeting (Steps 3 and 5).

Functional Leaders are responsible for providing comments to rated goals and providing details or idea’s for development plans. 

Managers – Reviewing performance scores and development from a higher level to ensure a consistent approach aligned with organization across their area.


Talent Management Team
